meanings.definition: To place in the care or custody of a trustee.
meanings.sent1: She trusteed her savings with a financial advisor.
meanings.sent2: The court trusteed the estate to a responsible individual.
meanings.sent3: He trusteed his favorite toy to his little sister, hoping she would take good care of it.
meanings.sent4: The responsibility of caring for the rare artifact was trusteed to the museum curator.
meanings.sent5: The precious family heirloom was trusteed to the eldest son for safekeeping.

meanings.sent1: He trusteed for his friend when she needed help managing her finances.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer trusteed for the elderly couple's estate for many years.
meanings.sent3: The cat trusteed for the fishbowl, making sure no harm came to the fish.
meanings.sent4: She trusteed for the community fund, ensuring transparency and accountability.
meanings.sent5: The responsible individual trusteed for the orphanage, overseeing the welfare of the children.

meanings.sent1: The trusteed funds were used for the benefit of the charity.
meanings.sent2: The trusteed property could not be sold without proper authorization.
meanings.sent3: The trusteed document was kept secure in the locked cabinet.
meanings.sent4: The trusteed account was monitored closely to prevent any misuse.
meanings.sent5: The trusteed agreement ensured fair treatment for all parties involved.
